intro: Eustephia longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract eustephia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that are surrounded by bracts, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, arranged in a basal rosette. Eustephia longibracteata is often found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
